paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Asp18Gly, including penetrance data and individual patient details.

patients.demographics: 42 year old male, 45 year old male
patients.phenotype: subarachnoid hemorrhage, cerebellar ataxia, pyramidal tract signs, bilateral mild sensorineural hearing loss

individual_records.phenotype_details: subarachnoid hemorrhage, pyramidal tract signs, cerebellar ataxia
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The authors reported on a 42 year old man (patient 1) and his 45 year old brother (patient 2), both suffering from subarachnoid haemorrhage (SAH) without and with hydrocephalus, respectively.

individual_records.phenotype_details: subarachnoid hemorrhage with hydrocephalus, pyramidal tract signs, cerebellar ataxia
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The authors reported on a 42 year old man (patient 1) and his 45 year old brother (patient 2), both suffering from subarachnoid haemorrhage (SAH) without and with hydrocephalus, respectively.

functional_data.summary: The variant leads to a glycine-for-aspartate substitution at position 18 of the TTR protein.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family as both affected individuals carry the variant.
variants.additional_notes: This is the second report of familial leptomeningeal amyloidosis with this TTR gene mutation.
key_quotes: This is the second report of familial leptomeningeal amyloidosis with an Asp18Gly TTR gene mutation, clinically causing only CNS symptoms.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
